New Records: Brice Sensabaugh set a career-high 34 points against the Miami Heat, with 20 coming in a dominant fourth quarter.
Key Match Events: Sensabaugh dropped 34 points against the Miami Heat on an efficient 12-of-18 from the field, including 7-of-11 from beyond the arc.
He used a mix of catch-and-shoot jumpers, stepback 3-pointers, and methodical drives to the basket.
Sensabaugh had a balanced shot mix against the Orlando Magic, with six baskets inside the arc to pair with his 5-of-6 shooting from deep.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Will Hardy emphasized the importance of Brice Sensabaugh's continued work on his game, making quicker decisions with the ball, and letting his talent shine through.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Hardy felt happy for Sensabaugh that he was able to have a good game back home in front of all of his people.
Sensabaugh credited his teammates and coaches for putting him in the right spots and trying to be as efficient as possible and execute.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Utah Jazz won two games over the course of 24 hours, with Sensabaugh being a go-to option for Utah's offense.
On the season, Sensabaugh is now up to 9.4 points per game (19.4 points per-36 minutes) on 42.7 percent from beyond the arc.
Others: The Jazz were without starters Keyonte George, Lauri Markkanen, and John Collins in the game against the Orlando Magic.
